description: [Ghanaian Times] Paris 2024 organisers cancelled training for open water swimming on Tuesday because of pollution in the River Seine.
title: Africa: Paris Swim Session Cancelled for Fifth Time Over Pollution

description: [IFJ] According to CAP's release, there are indications that other local dailies will soon follow a similar course. The release states that with the media sector facing huge financial challenges: 'the State shows the independent media contempt, and its branches continue to issue decisions and injunctions that suggest a clear and assumed desire to kill off the country's private news platforms'.
title: Africa: Senegal - Government Must Involve Press Organisations in Dialogue to Save the Press

description: [The Conversation Africa] Four years after the outbreak of Covid-19, the pandemic seems like a distant memory for many. Yet its impacts on our lifestyle today are often profound and long-lasting, with many researchers on a mission to quantify it across sectors.
title: Africa: Fewer Car Journeys and More Flights - How Covid-19 Has Changed the Way We Travel

description: [UCT] From 15 days to just 23 hours - that's the median turnaround time for full tuberculosis (TB) diagnosis that includes resistance testing to the most important TB drugs, according to a groundbreaking study published in the journal Open Forum Infectious Diseases on Wednesday, 31 July. This advance represents a significant leap forward in the fight against TB.
title: Africa: TB Diagnosis and Drug Resistance Testing Can Be Reduced to Just 23 Hours

description: [Capital FM] Johannesburg -- On the back drop of the ongoing Basketball Without Borders camp in Johannesburg, the National Basketball Association (NBA) Africa have donated USD50,000 (Kshs 6.5 million) in support of local community development initiative, Rhiza Babuyile.
title: Africa: NBA Africa Renews Hope for Former Inmates With Generous Donation

description: [ISS] Instead of reinforcing borders, African and Western governments should handle unprecedented migration levels by negotiating skilled-worker agreements.
title: Africa: Large-Scale Future Migration Will Reshape Global Demographics

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa -- The Economic Commission of Africa (ECA) announced that the 7th African Civil Registration and Vital Statistics Day will be observed across the continent this weekend by highlighting the importance of digitalization to enhance activities in civil registration and vital statistics.
title: Africa: ECA, AU to Mark African Civil Registration, Vital Statistics Day

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarly, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: Epidemic Preparedness - the Importance of Local Adaptation

description: [WHO-AFRO] Brazzaville -- The African region is experiencing an unprecedented increase in mpox cases since the start of 2024, with more countries previously unaffected by the disease reporting cases in an expanding spread of the virus.
title: Africa: African Region Faces an Unprecedent Surge in Mpox Cases

description: [UN News] Senior UN officials on Wednesday warned of the consequences for protection of women and their rights in conflict zones, amid recent decisions to close or shrink peacekeeping and special political missions.
title: Africa: Gender Equality At Risk - UN Officials Highlight Danger of Pulling Peacekeepers Out

description: [UN News] The head of the World Health Organization (WHO) called for an emergency meeting on mpox following its spread outside the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC).
title: Africa: WHO Moves to Highest Alert Over Mpox

description: [New Times] The World Health Organization (WHO) has called for increased support to address the rapidly spreading mpox outbreak across 17 African countries.
title: Africa: WHO Calls for Urgent Action to Address Mpox Surge in 17 African Nations

description: [Premium Times] "I urge anyone with evidence of malfeasance to contact our dedicated Counter-Corruption Unit. Evidence-based decisions, anchored in the rule of law, is how we defeat corruption and rebuild South Africa."
title: Africa: South Africa Ministry of Home Affairs Probes Chidinma Adetshina's Eligibility
